intro: Bertiera crinita, commonly known as the hairy bertiera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive hairy leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs, giving it a rough texture. The flowers are clustered in umbels and are surrounded by modified leaves called bracts.
